title: How to Become a VTuber (Equipment, Cost, & Hololive)

steps.title: Get a good quality computer with high-speed internet.
steps.content: Get a good quality computer with high-speed internet . No matter what kind of content you’re creating, this will be key. In general, you’ll probably want a newer desktop computer with at least 8 GB of RAM. A laptop works too, but it may run a little bit slower with the software you’ll need for VTubing. [1] X Research source

steps.title: You need a motion-tracking webcam.
steps.content: You need a motion-tracking webcam. Pick out a webcam that will recognize your face and translate your expressions onto an avatar. You can find a decent webcam like this for under $100, like the Logitech Pro or the Microsoft LifeCam. [2] X Research source

steps.title: You can upgrade to a VR rig if you want to later on.
steps.content: You can upgrade to a VR rig if you want to later on. It’s not necessary to track all of your movements (like your hands, legs, and feet) when you’re first starting out. However, if you ever want to upgrade your avatar to a full-body one, you might consider getting a VR, or virtual reality setup. You can find a decent VR headset for around $400. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Facerig, Luppet, VSeeFace, and VTube Studio are a few popular ones.
steps.content: Facerig, Luppet, VSeeFace, and VTube Studio are a few popular ones. [4] X Research source You can download most of these applications on both Windows and Mac. Some of them will help you create an avatar, while others are strictly for capturing motion and streaming your character . [5] X Research source Wakaru, 3tene, and Puppemoji are also good options. Most of these websites require a monthly or a one-time download fee. The price varies greatly depending on which one you’re using, but you can expect to spend around $100 on your software.

steps.title: Expect to spend between a few hundred and a few thousand dollars.
steps.content: Expect to spend between a few hundred and a few thousand dollars. The exact amount depends a lot on what you already have and how much you want to upgrade your equipment and your avatar. At minimum, you may have to shell out a few hundred dollars for a new webcam and a program to create a 3D model. [6] X Research source Feel free to get started as a VTuber with a limited amount of equipment. Over time, as you get better and start making money , you can upgrade your situation.

steps.title: Make your own in an online studio.
steps.content: Make your own in an online studio. If you want to customize your model, try using programs like Blender, Daz3D, or Pixiv. [7] X Research source In these studios, you can create a model from scratch, sculpting the facial features, body, and clothing items on your own. Both Blender and Pixiv have free versions, but they are slightly limited in what you can do. If you want to upgrade your account, you can pay a monthly fee of around $5 for full access. [8] X Research source To become a YouTuber, you should create content. Find something you are interested in and start filming. Then post it on YouTube. The more you post, the more you will understand what kind of content resonates with people on YouTube.

steps.title: Commission an artist to make you one.
steps.content: Commission an artist to make you one. If you aren’t feeling super artistic, try reaching out to an animator or a Photoshop expert to make a model for you. Find an artist in the community by searching “3D model commission” on Twitter or Google. Rates vary, but you can expect to spend around $50 to $100 for a commission. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Yes, if you download VTube studio.
steps.content: Yes, if you download VTube studio. This app lets you upload your 2D model directly onto your phone and track your facial movements. Keep in mind, though, that it doesn’t support 3D models just yet. [10] X Research source The iOS version (for Apple devices) has pupil tracking, but the Android version doesn’t. To download VTube studio, visit https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.denchi.vtubestudio&hl=en_GB .

steps.title: Find out when they’re holding auditions.
steps.content: Find out when they’re holding auditions. Hololive holds auditions every time they want to find new VTubers. They don’t have a set schedule, so you can check the website periodically to find out when they’re open by visiting https://en.hololive.tv/audition . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Submit an online application.
steps.content: Submit an online application. After you hit “Apply” on the Hololive auditions page, you’ll be transferred to an online questionnaire. Usually, the questionnaire will ask you to submit a 5-minute video explaining who you are and what your online persona is. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Go through the interview process.
steps.content: Go through the interview process. If your application is accepted, you’ll be invited to interview with the Hololive team! If you live near the offices, you can head there in person; otherwise, they’ll do it over the phone. They’ll ask you questions about your YouTube experience, why you want to join Hololive, and if you can keep up with the content they require. [13] X Research source
